docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-15 Israeli Faction on Verge Of Quitting Barak Coalition Israel's third largest political party, following up on six months of threats to bolt Prime Minister Ehud Barak's coalition, announced that it was quitting the government. But Mr. Barak asked the party, Shas, to wait 24 hours to see what could be resolved, and the party agreed. A1
docs.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-15    Israeli Faction on Verge Of Quitting Barak Coalition  Israel's third largest political party, following up on six months of threats to bolt Prime Minister Ehud Barak's coalition, announced that it was quitting the government....

docs.lead_paragraph: Police officers in Greenwich Village still remember her, the crazy, homeless bag lady who screamed at passers-by on Eighth Street in the 1980's, begged for spare change, or thrust her mad poetry into startled hands. Time and again, when she got too wild or the weather grew too bitter, the police carted her off to a psychiatric ward or a jail cell. Time and again, she returned to forage for food in garbage cans, to call out her love for the universe in an ecstasy of mania and marijuana, or to rail at the rich who walked by her on the sidewalk. Once, she even punched a stranger in the nose and sent his glasses flying.

headline.main: 'Treading Water To Save My Life'; A Cherished Key to a Home After Years on the Street

docs.abstract: Jill Flesch, formerly known as crazy bag lady of Greenwich Village, discusses her long struggle with mental illness and homelessness, and delight in her sunny new studio apartment off Times Square; photos; apartment is one of 55 in Ivan Shapiro House, supported housing development for formerly homeless men and women (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Five people who attributed health problems to the diet drug fen-phen were awarded $150 million in actual damages today by a jury here. The jurors were still determining punitive damages. The maker of the diet drug, American Home Products, has denied wrongdoing and said it would appeal.

headline.main: National News Briefs; 5 Awarded $150 Million In Diet-Drug Damages

docs.abstract: Five people who attributed health problems to diet drug fen-phen are awarded $150 million in actual damages by jury in Fayette, Miss; manufacturer, American Home Products, has denied wrongdoing (S)
